meanings.definition: A situation in which a large number of employees call in sick as a form of protest or strike.
meanings.sent1: The sickout caused a shortage of staff at the hospital.
meanings.sent2: The teachers organized a sickout to demand better working conditions.
meanings.sent3: During the sickout, the office felt strangely quiet without the usual chatter.
meanings.sent4: The sickout was like a silent protest echoing through the workplace.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the sickout was felt across the entire company.

meanings.sent1: Employees decided to sickout to show their dissatisfaction.
meanings.sent2: She chose to sickout as a way to make her voice heard.
meanings.sent3: The workers planned to sickout on Monday for better pay.
meanings.sent4: He sickouted to stand up for his beliefs.
meanings.sent5: Sickouting was their way of demanding change in the workplace.
